com.bugsnag.android

Class Bugsnag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bugsnag.android.Bugsnag

  • public final class Bugsnag
extends java.lang.Object
    Static access to a Bugsnag Client, the easiest way to use Bugsnag in your Android app. For example: Bugsnag.init(this, "your-api-key"); Bugsnag.notify(new RuntimeException("something broke!"));
    See Also:
    Client

                          java.lang.String apiKey)
        Initialize the static Bugsnag client
        Parameters:
        androidContext - an Android context, usually this
        apiKey - your Bugsnag API key from your Bugsnag dashboard

                          java.lang.String apiKey,
                          boolean enableExceptionHandler)
        Initialize the static Bugsnag client
        Parameters:
        androidContext - an Android context, usually this
        apiKey - your Bugsnag API key from your Bugsnag dashboard
        enableExceptionHandler - should we automatically handle uncaught exceptions?

      • setAppVersion

        public static void setAppVersion(java.lang.String appVersion)
        Set the application version sent to Bugsnag. By default we'll pull this from your AndroidManifest.xml
        Parameters:
        appVersion - the app version to send

      • getContext

        public static java.lang.String getContext()
        Gets the context to be sent to Bugsnag.
        Returns:
        Context

      • setContext

        public static void setContext(java.lang.String context)
        Set the context sent to Bugsnag. By default we'll attempt to detect the name of the top-most activity at the time of a report, and use this as the context, but sometime this is not possible.
        Parameters:
        context - set what was happening at the time of a crash

      • setEndpoint

        @Deprecated
public static void setEndpoint(java.lang.String endpoint)
        Deprecated. use Configuration.setEndpoint(String) instead.
        Set the endpoint to send data to. By default we'll send reports to the standard https://notify.bugsnag.com endpoint, but you can override this if you are using Bugsnag Enterprise to point to your own Bugsnag endpoint.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - the custom endpoint to send report to

      • setBuildUUID

        public static void setBuildUUID(java.lang.String buildUUID)
        Set the buildUUID to your own value. This is used to identify proguard mapping files in the case that you publish multiple different apps with the same appId and versionCode. The default value is read from the com.bugsnag.android.BUILD_UUID meta-data field in your app manifest.
        Parameters:
        buildUUID - the buildUUID.

      • setFilters

        public static void setFilters(java.lang.String... filters)
        Set which keys should be filtered when sending metaData to Bugsnag. Use this when you want to ensure sensitive information, such as passwords or credit card information is stripped from metaData you send to Bugsnag. Any keys in metaData which contain these strings will be marked as [FILTERED] when send to Bugsnag. For example: Bugsnag.setFilters("password", "credit_card");
        Parameters:
        filters - a list of keys to filter from metaData

      • setIgnoreClasses

        public static void setIgnoreClasses(java.lang.String... ignoreClasses)
        Set which exception classes should be ignored (not sent) by Bugsnag. For example: Bugsnag.setIgnoreClasses("java.lang.RuntimeException");
        Parameters:
        ignoreClasses - a list of exception classes to ignore

      • setNotifyReleaseStages

        public static void setNotifyReleaseStages(java.lang.String... notifyReleaseStages)
        Set for which releaseStages errors should be sent to Bugsnag. Use this to stop errors from development builds being sent. For example: Bugsnag.setNotifyReleaseStages("production");
        Parameters:
        notifyReleaseStages - a list of releaseStages to notify for
        See Also:
        setReleaseStage(java.lang.String)

      • setProjectPackages

        public static void setProjectPackages(java.lang.String... projectPackages)
        Set which packages should be considered part of your application. Bugsnag uses this to help with error grouping, and stacktrace display. For example: Bugsnag.setProjectPackages("com.example.myapp"); By default, we'll mark the current package name as part of you app.
        Parameters:
        projectPackages - a list of package names

      • setReleaseStage

        public static void setReleaseStage(java.lang.String releaseStage)
        Set the current "release stage" of your application. By default, we'll set this to "development" for debug builds and "production" for non-debug builds.
        Parameters:
        releaseStage - the release stage of the app
        See Also:
        setNotifyReleaseStages(java.lang.String...)

      • setSendThreads

        public static void setSendThreads(boolean sendThreads)
        Set whether to send thread-state with report. By default, this will be true.
        Parameters:
        sendThreads - should we send thread-state with report?

      • setUser

        public static void setUser(java.lang.String id,
                           java.lang.String email,
                           java.lang.String name)
        Set details of the user currently using your application. You can search for this information in your Bugsnag dashboard. For example: Bugsnag.setUser("12345", "james@example.com", "James Smith");
        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier of the current user (defaults to a unique id)
        email - the email address of the current user
        name - the name of the current user

      • clearUser

        public static void clearUser()
        Removes the current user data and sets it back to defaults

      • setUserId

        public static void setUserId(java.lang.String id)
        Set a unique identifier for the user currently using your application. By default, this will be an automatically generated unique id You can search for this information in your Bugsnag dashboard.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier of the current user

      • setUserEmail

        public static void setUserEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Set the email address of the current user. You can search for this information in your Bugsnag dashboard.
        Parameters:
        email - the email address of the current user

      • setUserName

        public static void setUserName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name of the current user. You can search for this information in your Bugsnag dashboard.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the current user

      • setErrorReportApiClient

        public static void setErrorReportApiClient(ErrorReportApiClient errorReportApiClient)
        Replaces the Default HTTP Client with a custom implementation. This allows for custom requirements such as certificate pinning to be achieved.

        The client implementation, and must be capable of sending Error Reports to the Bugsnag API, as documented here: https://docs.bugsnag.com/api/error-reporting/

        Parameters:
        errorReportApiClient - the custom HTTP client implementation

      • beforeNotify

        public static void beforeNotify(BeforeNotify beforeNotify)
        Add a "before notify" callback, to execute code before every report to Bugsnag. You can use this to add or modify information attached to an error before it is sent to your dashboard. You can also return false from any callback to halt execution. For example: Bugsnag.beforeNotify(new BeforeNotify() { public boolean run(Error error) { error.setSeverity(Severity.INFO); return true; } })
        Parameters:
        beforeNotify - a callback to run before sending errors to Bugsnag
        See Also:
        BeforeNotify

      • notify

        public static void notify(java.lang.Throwable exception)
        Notify Bugsnag of a handled exception
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to send to Bugsnag

      • notify

        public static void notify(java.lang.Throwable exception,
                          Callback callback)
        Notify Bugsnag of a handled exception
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to send to Bugsnag
        callback - callback invoked on the generated error report for additional modification

      • notify

        public static void notify(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String message,
                          java.lang.StackTraceElement[] stacktrace,
                          Callback callback)
        Notify Bugsnag of an error
        Parameters:
        name - the error name or class
        message - the error message
        stacktrace - the stackframes associated with the error
        callback - callback invoked on the generated error report for additional modification

      • notify

        public static void notify(java.lang.Throwable exception,
                          Severity severity)
        Notify Bugsnag of a handled exception
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to send to Bugsnag
        severity - the severity of the error, one of Severity.ERROR, Severity.WARNING or Severity.INFO

                          MetaData metaData)
        Deprecated. Use notify(Throwable,Callback) to send and modify error reports
        Notify Bugsnag of a handled exception
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to send to Bugsnag
        metaData - additional information to send with the exception

      • addToTab

        public static void addToTab(java.lang.String tab,
                            java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
        Add diagnostic information to every error report. Diagnostic information is collected in "tabs" on your dashboard. For example: Bugsnag.addToTab("account", "name", "Acme Co."); Bugsnag.addToTab("account", "payingCustomer", true);
        Parameters:
        tab - the dashboard tab to add diagnostic data to
        key - the name of the diagnostic information
        value - the contents of the diagnostic information

      • clearTab

        public static void clearTab(java.lang.String tabName)
        Remove a tab of app-wide diagnostic information
        Parameters:
        tabName - the dashboard tab to remove diagnostic data from

      • getMetaData

        public static MetaData getMetaData()
        Get the global diagnostic information currently stored in MetaData.
        See Also:
        MetaData

      • setMetaData

        public static void setMetaData(MetaData metaData)
        Set the global diagnostic information to be send with every error.
        See Also:
        MetaData

      • leaveBreadcrumb

        public static void leaveBreadcrumb(java.lang.String message)
        Leave a "breadcrumb" log message, representing an action that occurred in your app, to aid with debugging.
        Parameters:
        message - the log message to leave (max 140 chars)

      • leaveBreadcrumb

        public static void leaveBreadcrumb(java.lang.String name,
                                   BreadcrumbType type,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Leave a "breadcrumb" log message representing an action or event which occurred in your app, to aid with debugging
        Parameters:
        name - A short label (max 32 chars)
        type - A category for the breadcrumb
        metadata - Additional diagnostic information about the app environment

      • setMaxBreadcrumbs

        public static void setMaxBreadcrumbs(int numBreadcrumbs)
        Set the maximum number of breadcrumbs to keep and sent to Bugsnag. By default, we'll keep and send the 20 most recent breadcrumb log messages.
        Parameters:
        numBreadcrumbs - number of breadcrumb log messages to send

      • clearBreadcrumbs

        public static void clearBreadcrumbs()
        Clear any breadcrumbs that have been left so far.

      • enableExceptionHandler

        public static void enableExceptionHandler()
        Enable automatic reporting of unhandled exceptions. By default, this is automatically enabled in the constructor.

      • disableExceptionHandler

        public static void disableExceptionHandler()
        Disable automatic reporting of unhandled exceptions.

      • getClient

        public static Client getClient()
        Get the current Bugsnag Client instance.
